resources.string: to record and map your environment
to record and map your environment
There are errors in the form. Please fix them before continuing.
Record a new session to monitor your health & environment.
If you plan on moving around while recording measurements.
Your measurement device is no longer connected to the AirCasting app. Make sure Bluetooth is on and your measurement device is nearby.
Which streams would you like to delete?
Your AirBeam3 is now\nin stand-alone mode
AirBeam3 is now recording using its SD card. The measurements will be displayed here after syncing.
To see available networks list you need to turn on WIFI.
How would you like to add your session?
This is temporary button for the testing purposes
If you plan on moving around with the AirBeam while recording air quality measurements, configure the AirBeam to record a

session. When recording a mobile AirCasting session, measurements are created, timestamped, and geolocated once per second. After recording for >2 hours, your measurements will be integrated into 5-second averages. After recording for >9 hours, your measurements will be integrated into 1-minute averages. \n\nIf you plan to leave the AirBeam indoors or hang it outside then configure it to record a
session. When recording fixed AirCasting sessions, measurements are created and timestamped once per minute and geocoordinates are fixed to a set location.
To map your measurements, turn on location services.
Location services must be turned on to enable Bluetooth scanning.
You\'ll be prompted to turn off location services after you\'ve selected the Bluetooth device you\'ll be recording with.
Turn on Bluetooth to enable your phone to connect to the AirBeam.
If using AirBeam2, wait for the connection indicator to change from red to green before continuing.
If using AirBeam2, wait for the connection indicator to change from red to green before continuing.
What device are you using to record this session?
Choose the device you\'d like to record with.

string.name: select_device_refresh_button
string.u: Don\'t see a device? Refresh scanning.

resources.string: This should take less than 10 seconds.
Your AirBeam is connected to your phone and ready to take some measurements.
You can turn off location services now
Where will you place your AirBeam?
is ready to start gathering data.
Move to your starting location, confirm your location is accurate on the map, then press the start recording button below.
Search the address and adjust the marker to indicate an exact placement of your AirBeam
Hang your AirBeam in a secure position, then press the start recording button below.
Values beyond Min and Max will not be displayed.
Without location permissions you will not be able to record bluetooth sessions.
Without using location in background permission, the app may not work properly on newer Android devices.
Without location permissions you can\'t proceed with sync.
Location services are needed to center map on your location.
Audio permissions are required to continue
You need to have internet connection to edit session data
You need to have internet connection to reset your password
Something went wrong while editing session. Please try again.
You need to have internet connection to delete session
AirBeam connection failed. Please try again.
Active session already exists for this device.
All values needs to be present and fit the range (min < low < medium < high < max).
The session will be moved to
tab and you won\'t be able to add new measurements to it.
The session will be moved to
tab and you won\'t be able to add new measurements to it.
SD card will be cleared afterwards.
Data contributed to the CrowdMap is publicly available at aircasting.org
Turns off GPS tracking & session syncing. Use \'Share file\' to retrieve your measurements via email.
Turn your AirBeam off and then back on.
Select the device you\'d like to clear
This should take less than 10 seconds.
SD card inside your AirBeam3 was cleared successfully.
Sessions must be updated prior to syncing SD card. Make sure your device is connected to the Internet.
There was a problem while refreshing sessions. Please check your internet connection and try again.
Select the device you\'d like to sync
Keep your AirBeam close to your Android. Plug in your AirBeam to speed up the sync.
The data from your AirBeam3 was synchronized successfully to the app. The SD card was cleared.
Unexpected error happen. Please contact support.
To use the AirBeam3 in standalone mode and sync the SD card,\nAndroid 8 or higher + Bluetooth 5 are required
You are currently logged in as\n%1$s
Microphone is recording and Location Services are active
AirBeam is recording and Location Services are active
AirBeam is syncing data and Location Services are active
Or email a CSV file with your session data
Exported sessions will be emailed within minutes. The email may end up in your spam folder.
Session upload pending - wait a couple of minutes and try again.
Adjust via trial & error until the measurements in the app match your reference sound level meter. For most phones it\'s between 80 and 100.
An email with further instructions has been sent
To start a fixed session, connect your Android to the internet.
Generate a CSV file with your session data
AirBeam3 is weather resistant. To keep tabs on your outdoor air quality 24/7, hang one outside your home and record a fixed session.
record and map measurements from health and environmental monitoring devices
Find and follow a fixed air quality monitor near you and know how clean or polluted your air is right now.
Measure and map your exposure to air pollution
Connect AirBeam to measure air quality, humidity, and temperature.
In mobile mode, the AirBeam captures personal exposures.
In fixed mode, it can be installed indoors or outdoors to keep tabs on pollution levels in your home, office, backyard, or neighborhood 24/7.
Review our commitment to preserving your privacy and accept our privacy policy.

HabitatMap protects the personal data of AirCasting mobile application users, and fulfills conditions deriving from the law, especially from the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (GDPR). HabitatMap protects the security of the data of AirCasting app users using appropriate technical, logistical, administrative, and physical protection measures. AirCasting ensures that its employees and contractors are given training in protection of personal data. This privacy policy sets out the rules for HabitatMap’s processing of your data, including personal data, in relation to your use of the AirCasting mobile application.
Contact Details of the Personal Data Controller
Purposes & Legal Basis for the Processing of Personal Data
How HabitatMap collects your personal data?
Categories of the Recipients of Personal Data
Recipients of Personal Data Outside the European Economic Area
The controller of your personal data is HabitatMap Incorporated, with its registered office located at 34A St Marks Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11217 USA
You can contact the data controller: \n\u2022 postal address: 34A St Marks Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11217 USA \n\u2022 e-mail address: info@habitatmap.org

Your personal data may be processed for the purpose of: 

1. Performing a contract, or taking an action at your request prior to the conclusion of a contract, and for the purpose of pursuing claims under the contract (Article 6(1)(b) and (f) GDPR). HabitatMap processes your personal data to enable you to fully enjoy all the features of the AirCasting mobile app. Information, such as the fact of downloading the application and providing you with relevant content, may also be processed after the contract expiration (uninstallation of the app), among others, in the event of HabitatMap being accused of incorrect performance of its obligations. 

 2. Providing you, upon your request, with information about the state of air quality at your location, which is in the exercise of HabitatMap’s legitimate interest (Article 6(1)(f) GDPR). At your request, HabitatMap processes geolocation data to allow you to see the status of air quality at your location in the AirCasting app. At your request, HabitatMap may also send you PUSH notifications about the air quality status at your location. Sending notifications and access to geolocation data is voluntary and takes place with your consent, which can be withdrawn at any time, without prejudice to the use of other application functions. 

 3. Contacting you, at your request, and responding to your questions, which are in the exercise of HabitatMap’s legitimate interest (Article 6(1)(f) GDPR). HabitatMap allows you to send inquiries and suggestions for improvements to the app via email and will process the email address you provide for this purpose. 

 4. Maintaining, improving, and developing the application, and customizing some of the app content to your preferences, which are in the exercise of HabitatMap’s legitimate interest (Article 6(1)(f) GDPR). 

 HabitatMap processes information that may (but not necessarily) be considered personal data, using third-party-provided tools that perform similar functions to cookies to maintain, improve, and develop the app and to customize some of the content to your preferences.

HabitatMap has direct access only to the personal data you have provided. Some of the information about you that may (but not necessarily) be considered personal data is processed by HabitatMap through the use of tools that perform similar functions to cookies, provided to HabitatMap by third-party providers (referred to below).

HabitatMap uses the Firebase Analytics tool provided by Google LLC, which performs similar functions to cookies. In order to maintain, improve, and develop the app, and to customize some of the app content to your preferences, HabitatMap uses information provided by Firebase Analytics. This information may include the identifiers of the mobile devices you use, the language of the device, the time the app is opened, and other data you have provided to Google. HabitatMap is not able to recognize your identity from the data provided by Firebase Analytics. Information about Firebase Analytics and how it works can be found here: https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads and https://firebase.google.com/terms/. Data regarding your location may be used for the purpose of automated decision making, consisting in sending information regarding the current quality of air pollution in your location. Automated decision making for the purposes referred to above depends on your consent, which may be withdrawn at any time, without prejudice to the use of the other application functions.

This Privacy Policy may be subject to updates and changes. In such case, HabitatMap will take steps to inform you of any such updates or changes by, for example, sending you a notification. Notwithstanding the foregoing, HabitatMap recommends that you review this page as often as possible. This Privacy Policy was last updated on July 5, 2021.

A phone microphone session is already being recorded and displayed under the mobile active tab
When recording a mobile session, AirCasting will track your location even when the app is closed or not in use. Allow AirCasting to use your location all the time to map your mobile measurements.
Your note will be timestamped and displayed on the AirCasting map
Without Bluetooth permissions, you will not be able to see the available devices
